syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: apply Newton's laws of motion to the linear motion of a particle of constant mass moving under the action of constant forces, which may include friction, tension in an inextensible string and thrust in a connecting rod
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: If any other forces resisting motion are to be considered (e.g. air resistance) this will be indicated in the question.

learning_objectives.description: use the relationship between mass and weight
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: W = mg. In this component, questions are mainly numerical, and use of the approximate numerical value 10(ms⁻²) for g is expected.

learning_objectives.description: solve simple problems which may be modelled as the motion of a particle moving vertically or on an inclined plane with constant acceleration
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including, for example, motion of a particle on a rough plane where the acceleration while moving up the plane is different from the acceleration while moving down the plane.

learning_objectives.description: solve simple problems which may be modelled as the motion of connected particles.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. particles connected by a light inextensible string passing over a smooth pulley, or a car towing a trailer by means of either a light rope or a light rigid tow-bar.
